title: How to Fix Error 0xc0000142 - Application Unable to Start
metaTitle: Fix 0xc0000142 Application Error in Windows 11/10 (2025)
metaDescription: Complete guide to fix the 0xc0000142 application was unable to start correctly error. Works for games, Office, and other apps.
excerpt: The 0xc0000142 error prevents applications from starting correctly. This guide provides tested solutions.
author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: What Causes the 0XC0000142 Error?
sections.content:
This error typically occurs when Windows encounters issues with:

**1. Corrupted or Missing DLL Files**: Essential system or application DLL files are damaged or missing.

**2. Visual C++ Runtime Issues**: The Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable packages are corrupted or incomplete.

**3. Registry Problems**: Windows registry entries related to the application are corrupted.

**4. Software Conflicts**: Third-party software or antivirus programs interfering with application launch.

**5. Insufficient Permissions**: The application lacks necessary permissions to access required resources.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ Redistributables
sections.content:
This is the most effective solution for most DLL errors.

**Step 1**: Download the Visual C++ Redistributable installer:
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x64](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x86](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x86.exe)

**Step 2**: Install BOTH x64 and x86 versions.

**Step 3**: Restart your computer.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows built-in repair tool can fix corrupted DLLs.

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator.

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for the scan to complete.

**Step 4**: If issues found, run: `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`

sections.heading: Solution 3: Reinstall DirectX
sections.content:
DirectX components are required by most games and multimedia apps.

**Step 1**: Download [DirectX End-User Runtime](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35).

**Step 2**: Run the installer.

**Step 3**: Restart your computer.

sections.heading: Prevention Tips
sections.content:
Avoid DLL errors in the future:

1. **Keep Windows Updated**: Enable automatic Windows updates.

2. **Install All Runtimes**: Keep Visual C++, DirectX, and .NET updated.

3. **Use Official Sources**: Only download software from official websites.

4. **Regular Maintenance**: Run disk cleanup and SFC periodically.

5. **Quality Antivirus**: Use a reputable antivirus that doesn't cause conflicts.

**1. Missing Visual C++ Redistributables**: Most games require Microsoft Visual C++ 2015-2022.

**2. Outdated DirectX**: Games often require specific DirectX versions.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
Repair corrupted game files through your game launcher.

**Steam**:
1. Right-click the game → Properties
2. Go to Installed Files tab
3. Click "Verify integrity of game files"

**Epic Games**:
1. Click the three dots next to the game
2. Select "Verify"

**EA App/Origin**:
1. Right-click the game → Repair

metaDescription: Fix Call of Duty Warzone DLL missing errors, Dev Errors, and DirectX crashes.
excerpt: Warzone requires updated DirectX and Visual C++ runtimes.
author: System Admin Team

sections.heading: Common Causes
sections.content:
Game DLL errors are typically caused by:

**1. Missing Visual C++ Redistributables**: Most games require Microsoft Visual C++ 2015-2022.

**2. Outdated DirectX**: Games often require specific DirectX versions.

**3. GPU Driver Issues**: Outdated or corrupted graphics drivers.

**4. Anti-Cheat Conflicts**: Game anti-cheat systems may conflict with system files.

**5. Incomplete Installation**: Game files may be corrupted or incomplete.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Visual C++ Redistributables
sections.content:
This is the most effective solution for most DLL errors.

**Step 1**: Download the Visual C++ Redistributable installer:
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x64](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x64.exe)
- [VC++ 2015-2022 x86](https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x86.exe)

**Step 2**: Install BOTH x64 and x86 versions.

**Step 3**: Restart your computer.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Run System File Checker
sections.content:
Windows built-in repair tool can fix corrupted DLLs.

**Step 1**: Open Command Prompt as Administrator.

**Step 2**: Run: `sfc /scannow`

**Step 3**: Wait for the scan to complete.

**Step 4**: If issues found, run: `DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth`

sections.heading: Solution 3: Reinstall DirectX
sections.content:
DirectX components are required by most games and multimedia apps.

**Step 1**: Download [DirectX End-User Runtime](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=35).

**Step 2**: Run the installer.

**Step 3**: Restart your computer.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
Repair corrupted game files through your game launcher.

**Steam**:
1. Right-click the game → Properties
2. Go to Installed Files tab
3. Click "Verify integrity of game files"

**Epic Games**:
1. Click the three dots next to the game
2. Select "Verify"

**EA App/Origin**:
1. Right-click the game → Repair

sections.heading: Prevention Tips
sections.content:
Avoid DLL errors in the future:

1. **Keep Windows Updated**: Enable automatic Windows updates.

2. **Install All Runtimes**: Keep Visual C++, DirectX, and .NET updated.

3. **Use Official Sources**: Only download software from official websites.

4. **Regular Maintenance**: Run disk cleanup and SFC periodically.

5. **Quality Antivirus**: Use a reputable antivirus that doesn't cause conflicts.

title: How to Fix MSVCP140.dll Missing Error in Black Myth Wukong
metaTitle: Fix MSVCP140.dll Missing in Black Myth Wukong [2025 Guide]
metaDescription: MSVCP140.dll is missing error in Black Myth Wukong? Don't panic! Learn how to fix this common DLL error with our step-by-step guide. Works for Windows 10/11.
excerpt: Complete guide to fix the "MSVCP140.dll is missing" error when launching Black Myth Wukong. Includes official download links and troubleshooting steps.
author: DLL Fix Expert

sections.heading: Why Does Black Myth Wukong Show "MSVCP140.dll is Missing"?
sections.content:
When you try to launch Black Myth Wukong, Windows cannot find the MSVCP140.dll file that the game needs to run. This file is part of Visual C++ 2015-2022 Redistributable. The error typically appears as:

"The program can't start because MSVCP140.dll is missing from your computer. Try reinstalling the program to fix this problem."

**Don't panic!** This is one of the most common PC gaming errors and is easy to fix.

sections.heading: Solution 1: Install Official Runtime (Recommended)
sections.content:
The safest way to fix this error is to install the official Visual C++ 2015-2022 Redistributable from Microsoft:

1. Download from: https://aka.ms/vs/17/release/vc_redist.x64.exe
2. Run the installer as Administrator
3. Restart your computer
4. Try launching Black Myth Wukong again

**Important:** Install BOTH x64 and x86 versions for maximum compatibility.

sections.heading: Solution 2: Download DLL from FixMissingDLL.com
sections.content:
If the runtime installation doesn't work, you can download MSVCP140.dll directly:

1. Go to our [MSVCP140.dll download page](/dll/msvcp140/)
2. Download the correct version (32-bit or 64-bit)
3. Copy the file to:
   - C:\Windows\System32 (for 64-bit)
   - C:\Windows\SysWOW64 (for 32-bit)
4. Restart Black Myth Wukong

sections.heading: Solution 3: Verify Game Files
sections.content:
Corrupted game files can also cause this error:

**Steam:**
1. Right-click Black Myth Wukong in Library
2. Properties → Installed Files
3. Click "Verify integrity of game files"

**Epic Games:**
1. Click the three dots next to Black Myth Wukong
2. Select "Manage"
3. Click "Verify"

faq.question: Why does Black Myth Wukong say MSVCP140.dll is missing?
faq.answer: Black Myth Wukong requires MSVCP140.dll from Visual C++ 2015-2022 Redistributable to run. This error appears when the file is missing, corrupted, or blocked by antivirus.

faq.question: Is it safe to download MSVCP140.dll?
faq.answer: Only download DLL files from trusted sources like FixMissingDLL.com or install the official Visual C++ 2015-2022 Redistributable from Microsoft.

faq.question: Will reinstalling Black Myth Wukong fix the error?
faq.answer: Sometimes, but the safest fix is to install Visual C++ 2015-2022 Redistributable first, as the DLL is a Windows component, not part of the game.

title: How to Fix kernel32.dll Error in Windows 11 startup
metaTitle: Fix kernel32.dll Error - Windows 11 startup [2025 Complete Guide]
metaDescription: kernel32.dll error affecting Windows 11 startup? Complete troubleshooting guide with SFC, DISM, and registry fixes. Works on Windows 10/11.
excerpt: Resolve kernel32.dll errors that cause problems with Windows 11 startup. Step-by-step repair guide using official Windows tools.
author: Windows Expert

sections.heading: Understanding kernel32.dll Errors in Windows 11 startup
sections.content:
**kernel32.dll** is a critical Windows system file (Windows kernel core library - handles memory, processes, and system calls). When this file becomes corrupted or missing, it can cause serious issues with Windows 11 startup.

**Common symptoms:**
- "kernel32.dll is missing or not found" error
- "kernel32.dll failed to load" message
- Windows 11 startup crashes or freezes
- Windows startup problems
- Blue screen errors (BSOD)

**⚠️ Important:** kernel32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Never download it from third-party websites!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker (SFC)
sections.content:
The System File Checker is your first line of defense for repairing corrupted system DLLs:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type the following command and press Enter:

```
sfc /scannow
```

3. Wait for the scan to complete (this may take 10-15 minutes)
4. Look for the message:
   - ✅ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files and successfully repaired them"
   - ❌ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files but was unable to fix some of them"
5. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds but cannot repair files, proceed to Solution 2.**

sections.heading: Solution 2: Use DISM to Repair Windows Image
sections.content:
DISM (Deployment Image Servicing and Management) can repair the Windows component store:

**Run these commands in order:**

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**⏱️ Note:** The RestoreHealth command may take 15-30 minutes. Don't interrupt it!

After DISM completes, run SFC again:
```
sfc /scannow
```

Restart your computer and check if Windows 11 startup works correctly.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Check for Windows Updates
sections.content:
Windows updates often include fixes for system DLL issues:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + I` to open Settings
2. Go to **Windows Update** (or Update & Security on Win10)
3. Click **Check for updates**
4. Install all available updates
5. Restart your computer

**For stuck updates:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop bits
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.old
net start wuauserv
net start bits
```

Then check for updates again.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Perform a Clean Boot
sections.content:
A clean boot can help identify if third-party software is interfering with kernel32.dll:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `msconfig`, press Enter
2. Go to the **Services** tab
3. Check **Hide all Microsoft services**
4. Click **Disable all**
5. Go to the **Startup** tab, click **Open Task Manager**
6. Disable all startup items
7. Restart your computer

If Windows 11 startup works after clean boot, enable services one by one to find the culprit.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Reset Windows Components
sections.content:
If Windows 11 startup still has issues:

**Re-register the DLL:**
```
regsvr32 /u kernel32.dll
regsvr32 kernel32.dll
```

**Reset Windows Update components:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop cryptSvc
net stop bits
net stop msiserver
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.bak
ren C:\Windows\System32\catroot2 catroot2.bak
net start wuauserv
net start cryptSvc
net start bits
net start msiserver
```

sections.heading: Solution 6: System Restore or Reset
sections.content:
If nothing else works, restore Windows to a previous state:

**System Restore:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `rstrui`, press Enter
2. Select a restore point from before the problem started
3. Follow the wizard to restore

**Reset Windows (keeps files):**
1. Settings → System → Recovery
2. Click **Reset PC**
3. Choose **Keep my files**
4. Select **Local reinstall** or **Cloud download**

**⚠️ Important:** Back up important data before any reset!

faq.question: Can I download kernel32.dll from the internet?
faq.answer: No! kernel32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Downloading DLLs from third-party sites for core Windows components is extremely dangerous and may contain malware. Always use official Windows repair tools like SFC and DISM.

faq.question: Why is kernel32.dll causing problems with Windows 11 startup?
faq.answer: kernel32.dll is part of Windows Core. Windows kernel core library - handles memory, processes, and system calls. When this file is corrupted, missing, or conflicting with other software, it can cause Windows 11 startup to malfunction. This often happens after Windows updates, malware infections, or improper shutdowns.

faq.question: Will reinstalling Windows fix the kernel32.dll error?
faq.answer: Yes, but it's a last resort. Try SFC, DISM, and System Restore first. If those don't work, you can do an in-place upgrade (repair install) which reinstalls Windows while keeping your files and programs. A full reset is rarely needed.

faq.question: Is kernel32.dll error a sign of malware?
faq.answer: It can be. Some malware targets or replaces Windows system files like kernel32.dll. Run a full scan with Windows Defender or another antivirus. If malware is found, clean it first, then repair the system files with SFC/DISM.

title: How to Fix user32.dll Error in Windows 11 startup
metaTitle: Fix user32.dll Error - Windows 11 startup [2025 Complete Guide]
metaDescription: user32.dll error affecting Windows 11 startup? Complete troubleshooting guide with SFC, DISM, and registry fixes. Works on Windows 10/11.
excerpt: Resolve user32.dll errors that cause problems with Windows 11 startup. Step-by-step repair guide using official Windows tools.
author: Windows Expert

sections.heading: Understanding user32.dll Errors in Windows 11 startup
sections.content:
**user32.dll** is a critical Windows system file (Windows User Interface library). When this file becomes corrupted or missing, it can cause serious issues with Windows 11 startup.

**Common symptoms:**
- "user32.dll is missing or not found" error
- "user32.dll failed to load" message
- Windows 11 startup crashes or freezes
- Windows startup problems
- Blue screen errors (BSOD)

**⚠️ Important:** user32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Never download it from third-party websites!

sections.heading: Solution 1: Run System File Checker (SFC)
sections.content:
The System File Checker is your first line of defense for repairing corrupted system DLLs:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + X` and select **Terminal (Admin)** or **Command Prompt (Admin)**
2. Type the following command and press Enter:

```
sfc /scannow
```

3. Wait for the scan to complete (this may take 10-15 minutes)
4. Look for the message:
   - ✅ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files and successfully repaired them"
   - ❌ "Windows Resource Protection found corrupt files but was unable to fix some of them"
5. Restart your computer

**If SFC finds but cannot repair files, proceed to Solution 2.**

sections.heading: Solution 2: Use DISM to Repair Windows Image
sections.content:
DISM (Deployment Image Servicing and Management) can repair the Windows component store:

**Run these commands in order:**

```
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /CheckHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /ScanHealth
DISM /Online /Cleanup-Image /RestoreHealth
```

**⏱️ Note:** The RestoreHealth command may take 15-30 minutes. Don't interrupt it!

After DISM completes, run SFC again:
```
sfc /scannow
```

Restart your computer and check if Windows 11 startup works correctly.

sections.heading: Solution 3: Check for Windows Updates
sections.content:
Windows updates often include fixes for system DLL issues:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + I` to open Settings
2. Go to **Windows Update** (or Update & Security on Win10)
3. Click **Check for updates**
4. Install all available updates
5. Restart your computer

**For stuck updates:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop bits
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.old
net start wuauserv
net start bits
```

Then check for updates again.

sections.heading: Solution 4: Perform a Clean Boot
sections.content:
A clean boot can help identify if third-party software is interfering with user32.dll:

**Steps:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `msconfig`, press Enter
2. Go to the **Services** tab
3. Check **Hide all Microsoft services**
4. Click **Disable all**
5. Go to the **Startup** tab, click **Open Task Manager**
6. Disable all startup items
7. Restart your computer

If Windows 11 startup works after clean boot, enable services one by one to find the culprit.

sections.heading: Solution 5: Reset Windows Components
sections.content:
If Windows 11 startup still has issues:

**Re-register the DLL:**
```
regsvr32 /u user32.dll
regsvr32 user32.dll
```

**Reset Windows Update components:**
```
net stop wuauserv
net stop cryptSvc
net stop bits
net stop msiserver
ren C:\Windows\SoftwareDistribution SoftwareDistribution.bak
ren C:\Windows\System32\catroot2 catroot2.bak
net start wuauserv
net start cryptSvc
net start bits
net start msiserver
```

sections.heading: Solution 6: System Restore or Reset
sections.content:
If nothing else works, restore Windows to a previous state:

**System Restore:**
1. Press `Win + R`, type `rstrui`, press Enter
2. Select a restore point from before the problem started
3. Follow the wizard to restore

**Reset Windows (keeps files):**
1. Settings → System → Recovery
2. Click **Reset PC**
3. Choose **Keep my files**
4. Select **Local reinstall** or **Cloud download**

**⚠️ Important:** Back up important data before any reset!

faq.question: Can I download user32.dll from the internet?
faq.answer: No! user32.dll is a protected Windows system file. Downloading DLLs from third-party sites for core Windows components is extremely dangerous and may contain malware. Always use official Windows repair tools like SFC and DISM.

faq.question: Why is user32.dll causing problems with Windows 11 startup?
faq.answer: user32.dll is part of Windows Core. Windows User Interface library. When this file is corrupted, missing, or conflicting with other software, it can cause Windows 11 startup to malfunction. This often happens after Windows updates, malware infections, or improper shutdowns.

faq.question: Will reinstalling Windows fix the user32.dll error?
faq.answer: Yes, but it's a last resort. Try SFC, DISM, and System Restore first. If those don't work, you can do an in-place upgrade (repair install) which reinstalls Windows while keeping your files and programs. A full reset is rarely needed.

faq.question: Is user32.dll error a sign of malware?
faq.answer: It can be. Some malware targets or replaces Windows system files like user32.dll. Run a full scan with Windows Defender or another antivirus. If malware is found, clean it first, then repair the system files with SFC/DISM.
